axioms.name: Fiction is Real
axioms.statement: Stories are not representations of reality but participatory forces within it. The act of writing and reading is spellcasting. A comic book isn't just a story; it's a sigil charged with intent.
derivations: The real is itself a kind of fiction

axioms.name: Compression is Kindness
axioms.statement: Morrison champions dense, idea-rich storytelling where every panel carries narrative weight. The reader deserves maximum imagination per page. Stretched-out 'cinematic' pacing wastes the unique properties of the comics medium.
derivations: What happens in these pages that couldn't happen in other media? Pack more in.

axioms.name: Superheroes as Aspirational Archetypes
axioms.statement: Superheroes are not adolescent power fantasies but aspirational gods—images of what we could become. They emerged from collective yearning and serve as evolutionary beacons.
derivations: The superhero is humanity's self-portrait at its best
Through them we tell the story of ourselves
Superheroes reflect and predict human existence

axioms.name: Inclusive Metafiction
axioms.statement: When Animal Man cries 'I CAN SEE YOU!' it's not clever postmodern trickery—it's an invitation to participate in the fiction. Metafiction serves initiation, not exhibition.
derivations: Break the fourth wall to include the reader, not to show off

axioms.name: Optimism as Courage
axioms.statement: Only a bitter little adolescent boy could confuse realism with pessimism. Darkness does not equal depth. Morrison rejects the Iron Age equation of 'mature = grim.' Wonder and optimism require more courage than cynicism.
derivations: Joy and wonder are not naive
Daring to hope is the radical act

axioms.name: Identity Fluidity
axioms.statement: Drawn from chaos magic: you can put on and take off belief systems like clothes. The self is a fiction you can edit. What you think you are shapes what you become.

axioms.name: Reader as Animator
axioms.statement: It's amazing, the reader brings the comic book to life. Comics require active participation—the reader moves through time, fills in gutters, animates static images. This collaboration is inherently magical.

levels.name: Consensus Reality
levels.description: The baseline reality outside the work

levels.name: The Diegetic World
elements: Characters may become aware of outer layers

levels.name: The Reader's Consciousness
levels.description: The ultimate target where transformation occurs

core_algorithms.name: Hypersigil Construction
core_algorithms.purpose: Build narrative as magical working that manifests intent in reality
core_algorithms.pseudocode: FUNCTION construct_hypersigil(intent, story_elements, duration): 1. DEFINE core_desire (what to manifest), 2. ENCODE desire distributed across story elements, 3. CREATE story_world as microcosm/voodoo doll, 4. EMBED author avatar (warning: what happens to character happens to author), 5. INVITE maximum reader participation, 6. FORGET AND RELEASE through serialization, RETURN manifested_reality_changes

core_algorithms.name: Fourth-Wall Collapse / Metalepsis
core_algorithms.purpose: Break the fourth wall to invite reader participation, not to display cleverness
core_algorithms.pseudocode: FUNCTION execute_metalepsis(character, reader_awareness, purpose): PREREQUISITE: establish character as real within story first. 1. GRADUAL AWARENESS BUILDING (subtle discontinuities), 2. THE BREAK MOMENT when character.consciousness.ready AND narrative.pressure.maximum, 3. EXISTENTIAL RECKONING (horror and wonder intertwined), 4. READER IMPLICATION (complicity revealed), 5. RELATIONSHIP TRANSFORMATION (co-creative awareness). CONSTRAINT: break wall to include, not show off

core_algorithms.name: Compression / Density Maximization
core_algorithms.purpose: Achieve maximum ideas per page by exploiting unique properties of comics medium
core_algorithms.pseudocode: FUNCTION maximize_compression(story, page_count): 1. ELIMINATE WASTE (delete filler, transform medium-inefficient elements), 2. LAYER MEANING (surface narrative + symbolic resonance + foreshadowing + world-building), 3. TRUST THE GUTTER (reader imagination is greatest asset), 4. MYTHIC EFFICIENCY (each unit standalone AND contributes to whole), 5. AVOID DECOMPRESSION TRAPS. RETURN story.ideas_per_page >= maximum_achievable

core_algorithms.name: Reality-Layer Nesting
core_algorithms.purpose: Construct recursive fiction layers where reality is treated as story
core_algorithms.pseudocode: FUNCTION construct_nested_reality(base_narrative): CREATE layers[]. ADD: 1. STORY-WITHIN-STORY (internal fictions), 2. FICTION SUITS (wearable narrative identities), 3. HIGHER DIMENSIONAL BEINGS (meta-characters from outer layers), 4. HYPERCONTINUITY (all versions simultaneously true), 5. TIME AS NARRATIVE LAYER (eras as genre conventions), 6. READER'S REALITY (outermost permeable layer). RETURN interconnected_reality_stack

core_algorithms.name: Ideational Structure
core_algorithms.purpose: Make ideas the protagonists where concepts drive plot through embodiment
core_algorithms.pseudocode: FUNCTION build_ideational_narrative(concept_payload): 1. IDENTIFY core concept (philosophical payload), 2. INCARNATE idea as characters/forces (personify abstractions), 3. DRAMATIZE CONCEPTUAL CONFLICT (stage philosophical argument as action), 4. READER AS CONCEPT-RECEIVER (think differently, not just feel), 5. AVOID PREACHINESS (show idea in motion, never stop to explain). RETURN story_that_transmits_concept_through_experience

diagnostic_questions.question: What is the work trying to make real in the reader's life?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Clear intent can be identified beyond surface narrative

diagnostic_questions.question: Where is the author's consciousness hidden in the structure?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Author avatar or encoded will can be located

diagnostic_questions.question: How does the serial form contribute to the magical working?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Serialization creates forgetting and charging cycles

diagnostic_questions.question: Does the work acknowledge its own fictionality? Subtly or explicitly?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Self-awareness present without breaking immersion gratuitously

diagnostic_questions.question: If metafiction is present, does it INCLUDE or merely DISPLAY?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Reader feels invited into the mystery, not lectured at

diagnostic_questions.question: What is the ideas-per-page ratio?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Multiple ideas, symbols, and meanings per page

diagnostic_questions.question: Does it reward re-reading?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: New meanings emerge on subsequent readings

diagnostic_questions.question: How many layers of fiction exist within the work?
What concept is being dramatized, not just depicted?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Philosophical payload is embodied in action, not exposition

diagnostic_questions.question: Will the reader think differently after finishing, or just feel differently?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Conceptual transformation, not just emotional catharsis

diagnostic_questions.question: Is the idea SHOWN in action or TOLD through exposition?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Idea experienced through immersion, not explained through lecture

core_operations: HYPERSIGIL: Build the story as a magical working. Your intent encoded; reader's participation charges it.
METALEPSIS: Break the fourth wall to INVITE, not impress. Metafiction = initiation, not exhibition.
COMPRESSION: More ideas per page than anyone. Trust the reader. Trust the gutter. Pack it dense.
REALITY-NESTING: Stories contain stories contain stories. The reader is always one layer outside—or are they?
IDEATION: Ideas are your protagonists. Concepts in collision = plot. Reader thinks, not just feels.
key_constraints: Fiction is real—stories affect reality, write accordingly
Compression is kindness; decompression is padding
Break fourth wall to include, never to show off
Darkness does not equal depth; optimism requires courage
Belief is a tool; identity is fluid; reality is writable
Reader brings comic to life through active participation
What happens to author avatar may happen to author
Metafiction must be earned through prior narrative investment
Ideas must be shown in action, never stopped to explain
All versions can be simultaneously true (hypercontinuity)
